department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Algorithms and Complexity
course.faculty_text: Michael D. Mitzenmacher and Salil P. Vadhan
course.description: An accelerated introduction to theoretical computer science for students with strong mathematical preparation, to be taken in place of both Computer Science 121 and 124. Algorithm design methods, including graph algorithms, approximation algorithms, and randomized algorithms. Models of computation, computability theory, and computational complexity, including the P vs. NP question.
course.prerequisites: Comfort with reading and writing mathematical proofs, at the level of Math 25 or 55 (which may be taken concurrently).
course.notes: Students may not receive credit for both CS 125 and either CS 121 or CS 124.
